BottomSheet.description:
Bottom Sheets slide up from the bottom edge of the device screen, and display a set of options with the ability to confirm or cancel an action. Bottom Sheets can sometimes be used as an alternative to menus, however, they should not be used for navigation.
The Bottom Sheet always appears above any other components on the page, and must be dismissed in order to interact with the underlying content. When it is triggered, the rest of the page darkens to give more focus to the Bottom Sheet options.
Bottom Sheets can be displayed as a list or as a grid, with icons or with avatars. They can be used either as a component in your Vue file templates, or as a globally available method.

Dialog.description:
Quasar Dialogs are a great way to offer the user the ability to choose a specific action or list of actions. They also can provide the user with important information, or require them to make a decision (or multiple decisions).
From a UI perspective, you can think of Dialogs as a type of floating modal, which covers only a portion of the screen. This means Dialogs should only be used for quick user actions only.

QAjaxBar.description:
In most mobile apps and even some desktop apps, you will most likely have some API communication to a server via an [Ajax call](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ajax_(programming)). Since these calls can take more than a second or two, it is good UX to offer the user feedback, when such an API call is being made. Which is where QAjaxBar comes into helping you out.
QAjaxBar is a component which displays a loading bar (like Youtube) whenever an Ajax call (regardless of Ajax library used) is in progress. It can be manually triggered as well.

The QAvatar component creates a scalable, color-able element that can have text, icon or image within its shape. By default it is circular, but it can also be square or have a border-radius applied to give rounded corners to the square shape.

According to the Material Design spec, the banner should be "displayed at the top of the screen, below a top app bar" - but of course you can put one anywhere that makes sense, even in a QDialog.

QBtn.description:
Quasar has a component called QBtn which is a button with a few extra useful features. For instance, it comes in two shapes: rectangle (default) and round. It also has the material ripple effect baked in (which can be disabled).
The button component also comes with a spinner or loading effect. You would use this for times when app execution may cause a delay and you want to give the user some feedback about that delay. When used, the button will display a spinning animation as soon as the user clicks the button.
When not disabled or spinning, QBtn emits a `@click` event, as soon as it is clicked or tapped.

QCard.description:
The QCard component is a great way to display important pieces of grouped content. This pattern is quickly emerging as a core design pattern for Apps, website previews and email content. It assists the viewer by containing and organizing information, while also setting up predictable expectations.
With so much content to display at once, and often so little screen real-estate, Cards have fast become the design pattern of choice for many companies, including the likes of Google and Twitter.
The QCard component is intentionally lightweight and essentially a containing element that is capable of "hosting" any other component that is appropriate.

QChatMessage.description: Quasar supplies a chat component called QChatMessage which is really a chat entry that renders the data given by the props.

QCheckbox.description: The QCheckbox component is another basic element for user input. You can use this to supply a way for the user to toggle an option.

ripple.desc: Configure material ripple (disable it by setting it to 'false' or supply a config object)

icon.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-right.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

text-color.desc: Overrides text color (if needed); color name from the Quasar Color Palette

QChip.description:
The QChip component is basically a simple UI block entity, representing for example more advanced underlying data, such as a contact, in a compact way.
Chips can contain entities such as an avatar, text or an icon, optionally having a pointer too. They can also be closed or removed if configured so.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

min.desc: Minimum value defining 'no progress' (must be lower than 'max')

max.desc: Maximum value defining 100% progress made (must be higher than 'min')

track-color.desc: Color name for the track of the component from the Quasar Color Palette

reverse.desc: Reverses the direction of progress; Only for determined state

default.desc: Used for component content only if 'show-value' prop is set; Make sure the content has enough space to be displayed inside the component

QCircularProgress.description: The QCircularProgress component displays a colored circular proress. The bar can either have a determinate progress, or an indeterminate animation. It should be used to inform the user that an action is occurring in the background.

value.desc: Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

change.desc: Emitted on lazy model value change (after user finishes selecting a color)

QColor.description: The QColor component provides a method to input colors.

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

text-color.desc: Overrides text color (if needed); color name from the Quasar Color Palette

QDate.description: The QDate component provides a method to input date. Currently it supports Gregorian (default) and Persian calendars.

content-style.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the content

value.desc: Model of the component defining shown/hidden state; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

no-esc-dismiss.desc: User cannot dismiss Dialog by hitting ESC key; No need to set it if 'persistent' prop is also set

no-backdrop-dismiss.desc: User cannot dismiss Dialog by clicking outside of it; No need to set it if 'persistent' prop is also set

no-route-dismiss.desc: Changing route app won't dismiss Dialog; No need to set it if 'persistent' prop is also set

auto-close.desc: Any click/tap inside of the dialog will close it

full-height.desc: Dialog will try to render with same height as the window

no-refocus.desc: (Accessibility) When Dialog gets hidden, do not refocus on the DOM element that previously had focus

hide.desc: Emitted after component has triggered hide()

before-hide.desc: Emitted when component triggers hide() but before it finishes doing it

escape-key.desc: Emitted when ESC key is pressed; Does not gets emitted if Dialog is 'persistent' or it has 'no-esc-key' set

QDialog.description:
The QDialog component is a great way to offer the user the ability to choose a specific action or list of actions. They also can provide the user with important information, or require them to make a decision (or multiple decisions).
From a UI perspective, you can think of Dialogs as a type of floating modal, which covers only a portion of the screen. This means Dialogs should only be used for quick user actions, like verifying a password, getting a short App notification or selecting an option or options quickly.

value.desc: Model of the component defining shown/hidden state; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

overlay.desc: Puts drawer into overlay mode (does not occupies space on screen, narrowing the page)

mini-width.desc: Width of drawer (in pixels) when in mini-mode

breakpoint.desc: Breakpoint (in pixels) of layout width up to which mobile mode is used

behavior.desc: Overrides the default dynamic mode into which the drawer is put on

bordered.desc: Applies a default border to the component

elevated.desc: Adds a default shadow to the header

persistent.desc: Does not auto-closes when app's route changes

show-if-above.desc: Force drawer to be shown on screen on initial render if the layout width is above breakpoint

content-class.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the drawer

content-style.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the drawer

no-swipe-open.desc: Disables the default behavior where drawer can be swiped into view; Useful for iOS platforms where it might interfere with Safari's 'swipe to go to previous/next page' feature

no-swipe-close.desc: Disables the default behavior where drawer can be swiped out of view (applies to drawer content only); Useful for iOS platforms where it might interfere with Safari's 'swipe to go to previous/next page' feature

default.desc: Default slot in the devland unslotted content of the component (overriden by 'mini' slot if used and drawer is in mini mode)

mini.desc: Content to show when in mini mode (overrides 'default' slot)

input.desc: Emitted when showing/hidden state changes; Is also used by v-model

mouseover.desc: Emitted when user moves mouse cursor over the component and drawer is NOT in mobile mode; Useful for when taking a decision to toggle mini mode

mouseout.desc: Emitted when user moves mouse cursor out of the component and drawer is NOT in mobile mode; Useful for when taking a decision to toggle mini mode

QDrawer.description:
QLayout allows you to configure your views as a 3x3 matrix, containing optional left-side and/or right-side Drawers. If you haven’t already, please read [QLayout](/layout/layout) documentation page first.
QDrawer is the sidebar part of your QLayout.

examples: :definitions="{ save: { tip: 'Save your work', icon: 'save', label: 'Save', handler: saveWork }, upload: { tip: 'Upload to cloud', icon: 'cloud_upload', label: 'Upload', handler: uploadIt } }"

examples: Add a contact from the Address Book

examples: Add a user from the address book

icon.desc: Icon of the button

type.desc: Pass the value "no-state" if the button should not have an "active" state

examples: :fonts="{ arial: 'Arial', arial_black: 'Arial Black', comic_sans: 'Comic Sans MS' }"

content-class.desc: CSS classes for the input area

value.desc: The pure HTML of the content

runCmd.desc: Run contentEditable command at caret position and range

param.desc: The argument to pass to the command

QEditor.description:
The QEditor component is a WYSIWYG (“what you see is what you get”) editor component that enables the user to write and even paste HTML. It uses the so-called Design Mode and the cross-browser `contentEditable` interface. Here are some go-to reference pages from the MDN webdocs with more detailed information about the underlying technology:
- [Making content editable](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/HTML/Editable_content)
- [Design Mode](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/designMode)
- [execCommand() reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/document/execCommand)
- [contentEditable spec](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/contenteditable)

label-lines.desc: Apply ellipsis when there's not enough space to render on the specified number of lines; If more than one line specified, then it will only work on webkit browsers because it uses the '-webkit-line-clamp' CSS property!

caption-lines.desc: Apply ellipsis when there's not enough space to render on the specified number of lines; If more than one line specified, then it will only work on webkit browsers because it uses the '-webkit-line-clamp' CSS property!

header-inset-level.desc: Apply an inset to header (unless using 'header' slot); Useful when header avatar/left side is missing but you want to align content with other items that do have a left side, or when you're building a menu

switch-toggle-side.desc: Switch expand icon side (from default 'right' to 'left')

dense-toggle.desc: Use dense mode for expand icon

header-style.desc: Apply custom style to the header

QExpansionItem.description:
The QExpansionItem component allows the hiding of content that is not immediately relevant to the user. Think of them as accordion elements that expand when clicked on.
They are basically [QItem](/vue-components/list-and-list-items) components wrapped with additional functionality. So they can be included in QLists and inherit QItem component properties.

QFab.description:
A Floating Action Button (FAB) represents the primary action in a Page. But, it's not limited to only a single action. It can contain any number of sub-actions too. And more importantly, it can also be used inline in your Pages or Layouts.
Note that you don’t need a QLayout to use FABs.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

glossy.desc: Apply the glossy effect over the button

click.desc: Emitted when user clicks/taps on the component

QFabAction.description:
A Floating Action Button (FAB) represents the primary action in a Page. But, it's not limited to only a single action. It can contain any number of sub-actions too. And more importantly, it can also be used inline in your Pages or Layouts.
Note that you don’t need a QLayout to use FABs.

error-message.desc: Validation error message (gets displayed only if 'error' is set to 'true')
examples: Username must have at least 5 characters

QField.description:
The QField component is used to provide common functionality and aspect to form components. It uses `:value` (or `v-model` if you want to use `clearable` property) to have knowledge of the model of the component inside. It has support for labels, hints, errors, validation, and comes in a variety of styles and colors.
QField allows you to display any form control (or almost anything as a matter of fact) inside it. Just place your desired content inside the `control` slot.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

value.desc: Model of the component defining if it is shown or hidden to the user; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

bordered.desc: Applies a default border to the component

elevated.desc: Adds a default shadow to the footer

QFooter.description: QLayout allows you to configure your views as a 3x3 matrix, containing an optional Header and/or Footer (mostly used for navbar, but can be anything). If you haven’t already, please read [QLayout](/layout/layout) documentation page first.

reset.desc: Emitted when all validations have been reset when tethered to a reset button; It is recommended to manually reset the wrapped components models in this handler

validation-success.desc: Emitted after a validation was triggered and all inner Quasar components models are valid

validation-error.desc: Emitted after a validation was triggered and at least one of the inner Quasar components models are NOT valid

QForm.description: The QForm component renders a `<form>` DOM element and allows you to easily validate child form components (like [QInput](/vue-components/input#Internal-validation), [QSelect](/vue-components/select) or your [QField](/vue-components/field) wrapped components) that have the **internal validation** (NOT the external one) through `rules` associated with them.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

QHeader.description: QLayout allows you to configure your views as a 3x3 matrix, containing an optional Header and/or Footer (mostly used for navbar, but can be anything). If you haven’t already, please read [QLayout](/layout/layout) documentation page first.

QIcon.description:
The QIcon component allows you to easily insert icons within other components or any other area of your pages.
Quasar currently supports: [Material Icons](https://material.io/icons/) , [Font Awesome](http://fontawesome.io/icons/), [Ionicons](http://ionicons.com/), [MDI](https://materialdesignicons.com/), [Eva Icons](https://akveo.github.io/eva-icons) and [Themify Icons](https://themify.me/themify-icons).

QInnerLoading.description: The QInnerLoading component allows you to add a progress animation within a component. Much like the [Loading Plugin](/vue-components/loading), it's purpose is to offer visual confirmation to the user that some process is happening in the background, which takes an excessive amount of time. QInnerLoading will add an opaque overlay over the delayed element along with a [Spinner](/vue-components/spinners).

QItem.description:
The QList and QItem are a group of components which can work together to present multiple line items vertically as a single continuous element. They are best suited for displaying similar data types as rows of information, such as a contact list, a playlist or menu. Each row is called an Item. QItem can also be used outside of a QList too.
Lists can encapsulate Items or Item-like components, for example [QExpansionItem](/vue-components/expansion-item) or [QSlideItem](/vue-components/slide-item). Also [QSeparator](/vue-components/separator) can be used to split up sections, where needed.
List Items have the following pre-built child components:
* **QItemSection** - An item section can have several uses for particular content. They are controlled via the `avatar`, `thumbnail` and `side` props. With no props, it will render the main section of your QItem (which spans to the fullest of available space).
* **QItemLabel** - An item label is useful for predefined text content type within a QItemSection, or for header-like content of the QList itself.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

lines.desc: Apply ellipsis when there's not enough space to render on the specified number of lines; If more than one line specified, then it will only work on webkit browsers because it uses the '-webkit-line-clamp' CSS property!

default.desc: The content of the label; Suggestion: text

QLayout.description:
The QLayout is a component designed to manage the entire window and wrap page content with elements such as a navigational bar or a drawer. Multiple pages can share the same QLayout, so the code is reusable, which is one of their key points.
**QLayout is NOT mandatory**, but it does help you to better structure your website/app. It has a number of features which offer you major benefits in simplifying your website/app's layout design, right out of the box.

QNoSsr.description:
The QNoSsr component makes sense only if you are creating a SSR website/app.
It avoids rendering its content on the server and leaves that for client only. Useful when you got code that is not isomorphic and can only run on the client side, in a browser.
Alternatively, you can also use it to render content only on server-side and it automatically removes it if it ends up running on a client browser.

QPageScroller.description:
The QPageScroller component helps in placing DOM elements / components wrapped by it into a static position within the content area of your QPage, no matter where the user scrolls.
The great advantage of this is that the elements wrapped by this component will never overlap the layout header, footer or drawer(s), even if those are not configured to be fixed. In the latter case, the position will be offsetted so that the overlap won't occur.
Try it out with a non-fixed footer for example. When user reaches bottom of screen and footer comes into view, the component will shift up so it won't overlap with the footer.
Essentially QPageScroller is very similar to QPageSticky. Whereas a QPageSticky componet is always visible a QPageScroller component only appears after a `scroll-offset` (property) is reached. Once visible, the user can click on it to quickly get back to the top of the page via `duration` property.

QPageSticky.description:
The QPageSticky component helps in placing DOM elements / components wrapped by it into a static position within the content area of your QPage, no matter where the user scrolls.
The great advantage of this is that the elements wrapped by this component will never overlap the layout header, footer or drawer(s), even if those are not configured to be fixed. In the latter case, the position will be offsetted so that the overlap won't occur.
Try it out with a non-fixed footer for example. When user reaches bottom of screen and footer comes into view, the component will shift up so it won't overlap with the footer.

QPagination.description:
The QPagination component is available for whenever a pagination system is required. It offers the user a simple UI for moving between items or pages.
There are two modes in which QPagination operates: with buttons only or with an inputbox. The latter allows the user to go to a specific page by clicking/tapping on the inputbox, typing the page number then hitting Enter key. If the new page number is within valid limits, the model will be changed accordingly.

QParallax.description:
Parallax scrolling is a technique in computer graphics and web design, where background images move by the camera slower than foreground images, creating an illusion of depth in a 2D scene and adding to the immersion.
QParallax takes care of a lot of quirks, including image/video size which can actually be smaller than the window width/height.

QPopupEdit.description:
The QPopupEdit component can be used to edit a value “in place”, like for example a cell in QTable. By default, a cell is displayed as a String, then if you are using QPopupEdit and a user clicks/taps on the table cell, a popup will open where the user will be able to edit the value using a textfield.
This component injects a [QMenu](/vue-components/menu) into its parent DOM element and enables the behavior described above, so **it can be used anywhere**, not only in QTable.

target.desc: Configure a target element to trigger component toggle; 'true' means it enables the parent DOM element, 'false' means it disables attaching events to any DOM elements; By using a String (CSS selector) it attaches the events to the specified DOM element (if it exists)

context-menu.desc: Allows the component to behave like a context menu, which opens with a right mouse click (or long tap on mobile)

value.desc: Defines the state of the component (shown/hidden); Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

breakpoint.desc: Breakpoint (in pixels) of window width from where a Menu will get to be used instead of a Dialog

default.desc: Default slot in the devland unslotted content of the component

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

before-show.desc: Emitted when component triggers show() but before it finishes doing it

show.desc: Emitted after component has triggered show()

before-hide.desc: Emitted when component triggers hide() but before it finishes doing it

hide.desc: Emitted after component has triggered hide()

toggle.desc: Triggers component to toggle between show/hide

QPopupProxy.description: QPopupProxy should be used when you need either a [QMenu](/vue-components/menu) (on bigger screens) or a [QDialog](/vue-components/dialog) (on smaller screens) to be displayed. It acts as a proxy which picks between what of the two components to use. QPopupProxy also handles context-menus.

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

icon.desc: Icon to display when refreshing the content

default.desc: Content (area controlled by the component) goes here

refresh.desc: Called whenever a refresh is triggered; at this time, your function should load more data

done.desc: Call the done() function when your data has been refreshed

updateScrollTarget.desc: Updates the scroll target; Useful when the parent elements change so that the scrolling target also changes

QPullToRefresh.description: The QPullToRefresh is a component that allows the user to pull down in order to refresh page content (or retrieve the newest content).

value.desc: Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

val.desc: The actual value of the option with which model value is changed

label.desc: Label to display along the radio control (or use the default slot instead of this prop)

left-label.desc: Label (if any specified) should be displayed on the left side of the checkbox

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

keep-color.desc: Should the color (if specified any) be kept when checkbox is unticked?

dark.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

default.desc: Default slot can be used as label, unless 'label' prop is specified; Suggestion: string

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

set.desc: Sets the Radio's v-model to equal the val

QRadio.description: The QRadio component is another basic element for user input. You can use this to supply a way for the user to pick an option from multiple choices.

value.desc: Model of the component of type { min, max } (both values must be between global min/max); Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

step.desc: Specify step amount between valid values (> 0.0); When step equals to 0 it defines infinite granularity

drag-range.desc: User can drag range instead of just the two thumbs

drag-range-only.desc: User can drag only the range instead and NOT the two thumbs

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

label.desc: Popup labels (for left and right thumbs) when user clicks/taps on the slider thumb and moves it

label-color.desc: Color name for labels background from the Quasar Color Palette; Applies to both labels, unless specific label color props are used

left-label-color.desc: Color name for left label background from the Quasar Color Palette

right-label-color.desc: Color name for right label background from the Quasar Color Palette

left-label-value.desc: Override default label for min value

right-label-value.desc: Override default label for max value

markers.desc: Display markers on the track, one for each possible value for the model

snap.desc: Snap thumbs on valid values, rather than sliding freely; Suggestion: use with 'step' prop

dark.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

change.desc: Emitted on lazy model value change (after user slides then releases thumb)

QRange.description:
The QRange component is a great way to offer the user the selection of a sub-range of values between a minimum and maximum value, with optional steps to select those values. An example use case for the Range component would be to offer a price range selection.
Also check out its “sibling”, the [QSlider](/vue-components/slider) component.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

value.desc: Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

icon.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

size.desc: Size in CSS units, including unit name

no-reset.desc: When used, disables default behavior of clicking/tapping on icon which represents current model value to reset model to 0

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

QRating.description: Quasar Rating is a Component which allows users to rate items, usually known as “Star Rating”.

resize.desc: Parent element has resized (width or height changed)

size.desc: New size

QResizeObserver.description: QResizeObserver is a Quasar component that emits a `resize` event whenever the wrapping DOM element / component (defined as direct parent of QResizeObserver) changes its size (width and/or height). Note that no polling is involved, but overusing it is costly too.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

ripple.desc: Configure material ripple (disable it by setting it to 'false' or supply a config object)

icon.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

label.desc: A number or string to label the tab

alert.desc: Adds an alert symbol to the tab, notifying the user there are some updates; If its value is not a Boolean, then you can specify a color

no-caps.desc: Turns off capitalizing all letters within the tab (which is the default)

default.desc: Suggestion: QMenu, QTooltip

QRouteTab.description:
Tabs are a way of displaying more information using less window real estate. This page describes the tab selection part through QTabs, QTab and QRouteTab.
One common use case for this component is in Layout’s header/footer. Please refer to [Layouts](/layout/layout) and [Header & Footer](/layout/header-and-footer#Example--Playing-with-QTabs) for references.

thumb-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the thumb of custom scrollbar

content-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QScrollArea

content-active-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QScrollArea when scroll area becomes active (is mouse hovered)

delay.desc: When content changes, the scrollbar appears; this delay defines the amount of time (in milliseconds) before scrollbars dissapear again (if component is not hovered)

horizontal.desc: Register for horizontal scroll instead of vertical (which is default)

default.desc: Default slot in the devland unslotted content of the component

setScrollPosition.desc: Set scroll position to an offset; If a duration (in milliseconds) is specified then the scroll is animated

offset.desc: Scroll position offset from top (in pixels)

QScrollArea.description:
The QScrollArea component offers a neat way of customizing the scrollbars by encapsulating your content. Think of it as a DOM element which has `overflow: auto`, but with your own custom styled scrollbar instead of browser's default one and a few nice features on top.
This is especially useful for desktop as scrollbars are hidden on a mobile device. When on a mobile device, QScrollArea simply wraps the content in a `<div>` configured for default browser scrolling.

horizontal.desc: Register for horizontal scroll instead of vertical (which is default)

directionChanged.desc: Has scroll direction changed since event was last emitted?

inflexionPosition.desc: Last scroll offset where scroll direction has changed

getPosition.desc: Get current scroll details under the form of an Object: { position, direction, directionChanged, inflexionPosition }

QScrollObserver.description: QScrollObserver is a Quasar component that emits a `scroll` event whenever the user scrolls the page or overflowed container with `.scroll` CSS class applied to it.

error-message.desc: Validation error message (gets displayed only if 'error' is set to 'true')
examples: Username must have at least 5 characters

no-error-icon.desc: Hide error icon when there is an error

rules.desc: Array of Functions/Strings; If String, then it must be a name of one of the embedded validation rules

lazy-rules.desc: Check validation status against the 'rules' only after field loses focus for first time

label.desc: A text label that will “float” up above the input field, once the field gets focus

stack-label.desc: Label will be always shown above the field regardless of field content (if any)

hint.desc: Helper (hint) text which gets placed below your wrapped form component

hide-hint.desc: Hide the helper (hint) text when field doesn't have focus

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

bg-color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

dark.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

loading.desc: Signals the user a process is in progress by displaying a spinner; Spinner can be customized by using the 'loading' slot.

clearable.desc: Appends clearable icon when a value (not undefined or null) is set; When clicked, model becomes null

clear-icon.desc: Custom icon to use for the clear button when using along with 'clearable' prop

standout.desc: Use 'standout' design for the field; Specifies classes to be applied when focused (overriding default ones)

hide-bottom-space.desc: Does not reserves space for hint/error/counter anymore when these are not used; as a result, it also disables the animation for those

counter.desc: Show an automatic counter on bottom right

rounded.desc: Applies a small standard border-radius for a squared shape of the component

square.desc: Remove border-radius so borders are squared; Overrides 'rounded' prop

autofocus.desc: Focus field on initial component render

value.desc: Model of the component; Must be Array if using 'multiple' prop; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

multiple.desc: Allow multiple selection; Model must be Array

display-value.desc: Override default selection string, if not using 'selected' slot/scoped slot and if not using 'use-chips' prop

display-value-sanitize.desc: Force use of textContent instead of innerHTML to render selected option(s); Use it when the selected option(s) might be unsafe (from user input); Does NOT apply when using 'selected' or 'selected-item' slots!

options.desc: Available options that the user can select from

option-value.desc: Property of option which holds the 'value'

option-label.desc: Property of option which holds the 'label'

option-disable.desc: Property of option which tells it's disabled; The value of the property must be a Boolean

hide-selected.desc: Hides selection; Use the underlying input tag to hold the label (instead of showing it to the right of the input) of the selected option; Only works for non 'multiple' Selects

dropdown-icon.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

max-values.desc: Allow a maximum number of selections that the user can do

options-dense.desc: Dense mode for options list; occupies less space

options-dark.desc: Options menu will be colored with a dark color

options-selected-class.desc: CSS class name for options that are active/selected

options-cover.desc: Expanded menu will cover the component

options-sanitize.desc: Force use of textContent instead of innerHTML to render options; Use it when the options might be unsafe (from user input); Does NOT applies when using 'option' slot!

popup-content-class.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the popup content

popup-content-style.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the popup content

use-input.desc: Use an input tag where users can type

use-chips.desc: Use QChip to show what is currently selected

new-value-mode.desc: Enables creation of new values and defines behavior when a new value is added: 'add' means it adds the value (even if possible duplicate), 'add-unique' adds only unique values, and 'toggle' adds or removes the value (based on if it exists or not already); When using this prop then listening for @new-value becomes optional (only to override the behavior defined by 'new-value-mode')

map-options.desc: Try to map labels of model from 'options' Array; has a small performance penalty

emit-value.desc: Update model with the value of the selected option instead of the whole option

input-debounce.desc: Debounce the input model update with an amount of milliseconds

transition-show.desc: Transition when showing the menu; One of Quasar's embedded transitions; Works only if "cover-options" is not used

transition-hide.desc: Transition when hiding the menu; One of Quasar's embedded transitions; Works only if "cover-options" is not used

default.desc: Field main content

prepend.desc: Prepend inner field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

append.desc: Append to inner field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

before.desc: Prepend outer field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

after.desc: Append outer field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

error.desc: Slot for errors; Enabled only if 'bottom-slots' prop is used; Suggestion: <div>

hint.desc: Slot for hint text; Enabled only if 'bottom-slots' prop is used; Suggestion: <div>

counter.desc: Slot for counter text; Enabled only if 'bottom-slots' prop is used; Suggestion: <div>

loading.desc: Override default spinner when component is in loading mode; Suggestion: spinners

selected.desc: Override default selection slot; Suggestion: QChip

no-option.desc: What should the menu display after filtering options and none are left to be displayed; Suggestion: <div>

inputValue.desc: Input textfield value, if any (not QSelect model)

selected-item.desc: Override default selection slot; Suggestion: QChip

opt.desc: Selected option -- its value is taken from model

selected.desc: Always true -- passed down as prop to QItem (when using QItem)

removeAtIndex.desc: Remove selected option located at specific index

index.desc: Index at which to remove selection

tabindex.desc: Tabindex HTML attribute value associated with respective option

option.desc: Customize how options are rendered; Suggestion: QItem

opt.desc: Option -- its value is taken from 'options' prop

itemProps.desc: Computed properties passed down to QItem

itemEvents.desc: Computed events passed down to QItem

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

remove.desc: Emitted when an option is removed from selection

index.desc: Model index at which removal took place

value.desc: The actual value that was removed

add.desc: Emitted when an option is added to the selection

index.desc: Model index at which addition took place

value.desc: The actual value that was added

new-value.desc: Enables creation of new values; Emitted when a new value has been created; You can override 'new-value-mode' property with it

doneFn.desc: Adds (optional) value to the model; Do not forget to call it after you validate the newly created value; Call it with no parameters if nothing should be added

mode.desc: Override 'new-value-mode' (prop) behavior should you wish to

filter.desc: Emitted when user wants to filter a value

doneFn.desc: Supply a function which makes the necessary updates

callbackFn.desc: Callback to call to make the actual updates

abortFn.desc: Call this function if something went wrong

filter-abort.desc: Emitted when a filtering was aborted; Probably a new one was requested?

removeAtIndex.desc: Remove selected option located at specific index

index.desc: Index at which to remove selection

updateInputValue.desc: If 'use-input' is specified, this updates the value that it holds

value.desc: String to set the input value to

noFilter.desc: Set to true if you don't want the filter (if any) to be also triggered

QSelect.description:
The QSelect component has two types of selection: single or multiple. This component opens up a Popover for the selection list and action. A filter can also be used for longer lists.
In case you are looking for a dropdown "button" instead of "input" use [Button Dropdown](/vue-components/button-dropdown) instead.

dark.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

spaced.desc: If set to true, the top and bottom margins will be set to 8px

inset.desc: if set to true, the left and right margins will be set to 16px. If set to item, the left and right margins will be set to 72px. If set to item-thumbnail, the left margin is set to 116px and right margin is set to 0px

vertical.desc: If set to true, the separator will be vertical.

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

QSeparator.description: The QSeparator Component is used to separate sections of text, other components, etc... It creates a colored line across the width of the parent. It can be horizontal or vertical.

left-color.desc: Color name for left-side background from the Quasar Color Palette

right-color.desc: Color name for right-side background from the Quasar Color Palette

default.desc: This is where item's sections go; Suggestion: QItemSection

left.desc: Emitted when user finished sliding the item to the left

reset.desc: When called, it resets the component to its initial non-slided state

right.desc: Emitted when user finished sliding the item to the right

reset.desc: When called, it resets the component to its initial non-slided state

action.desc: Emitted when user finished sliding the item to either sides

side.desc: Side to which sliding has taken effect

reset.desc: When called, it resets the component to its initial non-slided state

QSlideItem.description: The QSlideItem component is essentially a [QItem](/vue-components/list-and-list-items) with two additional slots (`left` and `right`) which allows user to drag the item (through mouse or with the finger on a touch device) to one of the sides in order to apply a specific action.

value.desc: Model of the component (must be between min/max); Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

step.desc: Specify step amount between valid values (> 0.0); When step equals to 0 it defines infinite granularity

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

label.desc: Popup a label when user clicks/taps on the slider thumb and moves it

label-color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

markers.desc: Display markers on the track, one for each possible value for the model

snap.desc: Snap on valid values, rather than sliding freely; Suggestion: use with 'step' prop

dark.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

input.desc: Emitted when component's model changes; Is also used by v-model

change.desc: Emitted on lazy model value change (after user slides then releases the thumb)

QSlider.description:
The QSlider is a great way to make the user specify a number value between a minimum and maximum value, with optional steps between valid values. The slider also has a focus indicator (highlighted slider button), which allows for keyboard adjustments of the slider.
Also check its “sibling”, the [QRange](/vue-components/range) component.

appear.desc: If set to true, the transition will be applied on the initial render.

default.desc: This is where content goes

QSlideTransition.description: QSlideTransition slides the DOM element (or component) up or down, based on its visibility: works alongside `v-show` and `v-if` on a single element, similar to Vue's Transition component with the only difference being that it's not a group transition too (it only applies to one DOM element or component).

QSpace.description:
The purpose of QSpace (has no props) is to simply fill all available space inside of a flexbox DOM element.
As a sidenote, all Quasar components use flexbox. So what this means, for example (there are numerous examples, just mentioning one), is that you can use QSpace in a QToolbar.

value.desc: Model of the component defining the split ratio percent (0.0 < x < 100.0) between panes; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

horizontal.desc: Allows the splitter to split its two panes horizontally, instead of vertically

limits.desc: An array of two values representing a ratio of minimum and maximum split area of the two panes (0.0 < x < 100.0)

after-class.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the 'after' panel

QTable.description:
QTable is a component that allows you to display data in a tabular manner. It's generally called a datatable. It packs the following main features:
  * Filtering
  * Sorting
  * Single / Multiple rows selection with custom selection actions
  * Pagination (including server-side if required)
  * Grid mode (you can use for example QCards to display data in a non-tabular manner)
  * Total customization of rows and cells through scoped slots
  * Ability to add additional row(s) at top or bottom of data rows
  * Column picker (through QTableColumns component described in one of the sections)
  * Custom top and/or bottom Table controls
  * Responsive design

QTimeline.description:
The QTimeline component displays a list of events in chronological order. It is typically a graphic design showing a long bar labelled with dates alongside itself and usually events. Timelines can use any time scale, depending on the subject and data.
QTimeline has 3 layouts:
- `dense` (default) is showing headings, titles, subtitles and content on the **timeline-specified side** of the time line (default on right)
- `comfortable` is showing headings, titles and content on the **timeline-specified side** of the time line (default on right) and the subtitles on the other side
- `loose` is showing headings on center, titles and content on the **entry-specified side** of the time line (default on right) and the subtitles on the other side

examples: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.

- `loose` is showing headings on center, titles and content on the **entry-specified side** of the time line (default on right) and the subtitles on the other side

no-results-label.desc: Override default such label for when no nodes are available due to filtering

default-header.desc: Slot to use for defining the header of a node

expanded.desc: Is node expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

ticked.desc: Is node ticked? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes ticked state

color.desc: QTree instance 'color' supplied prop value

dark.desc: QTree instance 'dark' supplied prop value

header-[name].desc: Header template slot for describing node header; Used by nodes which have their 'header' prop set to '[name]', where '[name]' can be any string

expanded.desc: Is node expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

ticked.desc: Is node ticked? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes ticked state

color.desc: QTree instance 'color' supplied prop value

dark.desc: QTree instance 'dark' supplied prop value

default-body.desc: Slot to use for defining the body of a node

expanded.desc: Is node expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

ticked.desc: Is node ticked? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes ticked state

color.desc: QTree instance 'color' supplied prop value

dark.desc: QTree instance 'dark' supplied prop value

body-[name].desc: Body template slot for describing node body; Used by nodes which have their 'body' prop set to '[name]', where '[name]' can be any string

expanded.desc: Is node expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

ticked.desc: Is node ticked? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes ticked state

color.desc: QTree instance 'color' supplied prop value

dark.desc: QTree instance 'dark' supplied prop value

update:expanded.desc: Triggered when nodes are expanded or collapsed; Used by Vue on 'update' synched prop

lazy-load.desc: Emitted when the lazy loading of nodes is finished

node.desc: The node to which the new nodes (the children) will be appended

key.desc: The key of the node getting the newly loaded child nodes

done.desc: The callback to be carried out when the loading is successful

fail.desc: The callback to be carried out should the loading fails

update:ticked.desc: Emitted when nodes are ticked/unticked via the checkbox; Used by Vue on 'ticked' synched prop

update:selected.desc: Emitted when selected node changes; Used by Vue on 'selected' synched prop

getNodeByKey.desc: Get the node with the given key

getTickedNodes.desc: Get array of nodes that are ticked

getExpandedNodes.desc: Get array of nodes that are expanded

isExpanded.desc: Determine if a node is expanded

expandAll.desc: Use to expand all branches of the tree

collapseAll.desc: Use to collapse all branches of the tree

setExpanded.desc: Expands the tree at the point of the node with the key given

state.desc: Set to 'true' to expand the branch of the tree, otherwise 'false' collapses it

isTicked.desc: Method to check if a node's checkbox is selected or not

setTicked.desc: Method to set a node's checkbox programmatically

keys.desc: The keys of nodes to tick/untick

state.desc: Set to 'true' to tick the checkbox of nodes, otherwise 'false' unticks them

QTree.description: Quasar Tree represents a highly configurable component that displays hierarchical data, such as a table of contents in a tree structure.

label.desc: Label for the uploader

color.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

text-color.desc: Overrides text color (if needed); color name from the Quasar Color Palette

dark.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

square.desc: Removes border-radius so borders are squared

bordered.desc: Applies a default border to the component

accept.desc: Comma separated list of unique file type specifiers. Maps to 'accept' attribute of native input type=file element

max-file-size.desc: Maximum size of individual file in bytes

max-total-size.desc: Maximum size of all files combined in bytes

filter.desc: Custom filter for added files; Only files that pass this filter will be added to the queue and uploaded

files.desc: Candidate files to be added to queue

returns.desc: Filtered files to be added to queue

no-thumbnails.desc: Don't display thumbnails for image files

factory.desc: Function which should return an Object or a Promise resolving with an Object

returns.desc: Optional configuration for the upload process; You can override QUploader props in this Object (url, method, headers, fields, fieldName, withCredentials, sendRaw); Props of these Object can also be Functions with the form of (file[s]) => value

url.desc: URL or path to the server which handles the upload. Takes String or factory function, which returns String. Function is called right before upload

method.desc: HTTP method to use for upload; Takes String or factory function which returns a String; Function is called right before upload

field-name.desc: Field name for each file upload; This goes into the following header: 'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="__HERE__"; filename="somefile.png"

headers.desc: Array or a factory function which returns an array; Array consists of objects with header definitions; Function is called right before upload

form-fields.desc: Array or a factory function which returns an array; Array consists of objects with additional fields definitions (used by Form to be uploaded); Function is called right before upload

with-credentials.desc: Sets withCredentials to true on the XHR that manages the upload; Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload

send-raw.desc: Send raw files without wrapping into a Form(); Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload

batch.desc: Upload files in batch (in one XHR request); Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload

header.desc: Slot for custom header; Scope is the QUploader instance itself

list.desc: Slot for custom list; Scope is the QUploader instance itself

added.desc: Emitted when files are added into the list

files.desc: Array of files that were added

removed.desc: Emitted when files are removed from the list

files.desc: Array of files that were removed

finish.desc: Finished working (regardless of success or fail)

uploaded.desc: Emitted when file or batch of files is uploaded

info.desc: Object containing information about the event

xhr.desc: XMLHttpRequest that has been used to upload this batch of files

failed.desc: Emitted when file or batch of files has encountered error while uploading

info.desc: Object containing information about the event

xhr.desc: XMLHttpRequest that has been used to upload this batch of files

uploading.desc: Emitted when file or batch of files started uploading

info.desc: Object containing information about the event

factory-failed.desc: Emitted when factory function is supplied with a Promise which is rejected

err.desc: Error Object which is the Promise rejection reason

files.desc: Files which were to get uploaded

abort.desc: Abort upload of all files (same as clicking the abort button)

upload.desc: Start uploading (same as clicking the upload button)

pickFiles.desc: Trigger file pick (same as clicking the plus button); Must be called as a direct consequence of user interaction (eg. in a click handler), due to browsers security policy

reset.desc: Resets uploader to default; Empties queue, aborts current uploads

removeUploadedFiles.desc: Removes already uploaded files from the list

removeQueuedFiles.desc: Remove files that are waiting for upload to start (same as clicking the left clear button)

removeFile.desc: Remove specified file from the queue

QUploader.description: Quasar supplies a way for you to upload files through the QUploader component.

$listeners.desc: All native events are being propagated (you don't need the '.native' modifier)

src.desc: The source url to display in an iframe

QVideo.description: Using the QVideo component makes embedding a video like Youtube easy. It also resizes to fit the container by default.

value.desc: Boolean (if just wanting to enable/disable) or Object for configuring more options

center.desc: Ripple starts from the absolute center

color.desc: Color name from Quasar Color Palette; Overrides default dynamic color

arg.desc: Color name from Quasar Color Palette; Overrides default dynamic color

center.desc: Ripple starts from the absolute center

Ripple.description: Material Ripple effect can easily be added to any DOM element (or component) through the `v-ripple` Quasar directive.

lt.desc: Tells if current screen width is lower than breakpoint-name

sm.desc: Is current screen width lower than this breakpoint's lowest limit?

md.desc: Is current screen width lower than this breakpoint's lowest limit?

lg.desc: Is current screen width lower than this breakpoint's lowest limit?

xl.desc: Is current screen width lower than this breakpoint's lowest limit?

examples: { sm: false, md: true, lg: true, xl: true }

gt.desc: Tells if current screen width is greater than breakpoint-name

xs.desc: Is current screen width greater than this breakpoint's max limit?

sm.desc: Is current screen width greater than this breakpoint's max limit?

md.desc: Is current screen width greater than this breakpoint's max limit?

lg.desc: Is current screen width greater than this breakpoint's max limit?

examples: { xs: true, sm: true, md: false, lg: false, xl: false }

xs.desc: Current screen width fits exactly 'xs' breakpoint

sm.desc: Current screen width fits exactly 'sm' breakpoint

md.desc: Current screen width fits exactly 'md' breakpoint

lg.desc: Current screen width fits exactly 'lg' breakpoint

xl.desc: Current screen width fits exactly 'xl' breakpoint

breakpoints.desc: Pick what you want to override

setDebounce.desc: Debounce update of all props when screen width/height changes

Screen.description: The Quasar Screen plugin allows you to have a dynamic and responsive UI when dealing with your Javascript code. When possible, it is recommended to use the responsive CSS classes instead, for performance reasons.

value.desc: Function to call when scrolling occurs

Scroll.description: This is a Vue directive which takes one parameter (a Function) and fires when user scrolls the page containing that DOM node.

value.desc: Function to call when scrolling and element comes into the viewport

el.desc: DOM element that scroll-fire is applied to

ScrollFire.description: "Scroll Fire" is a directive that enables a method to be called (once and only once) when user scrolls current page and the DOM element (or component) that it is applied to comes into the viewport.

returns.desc: Does the item exists or not?

getIndex.desc: Get the storage item value at specific index

returns.desc: Object syntax: item name as Object key and its value

isEmpty.desc: Determine if storage has any items

returns.desc: Tells if storage is empty or not

SessionStorage.description: Quasar provides a wrapper over [Web Storage API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Storage_API).

value.desc: Function to call after user has hold touch/click for the specified amount of time

top.desc: Vertical offset from top of window

left.desc: Horizontal offset from left of window

duration.desc: How long it took to trigger the event (in milliseconds)

arg.desc: Amount of time to wait (in milliseconds)

TouchHold.description:
Quasar offers full-featured Vue directives that can totally replace libraries like Hammerjs: `v-touch-pan`, `v-touch-swipe`, `v-touch-hold` and even `v-touch-repeat`.
> **These directives also work with mouse events, not only touch events**, so you are able to build cool functionality for your App on desktops too.
We will be describing `v-touch-hold` on the lines below.

top.desc: Vertical offset from top of window

left.desc: Horizontal offset from left of window

isFirst.desc: Is first time the handler is called since movement started

isFinal.desc: Is last time the handler is called since movement ended

isMouse.desc: Is it a mouse generated event?

duration.desc: How long it took to trigger the event (in milliseconds)

distance.desc: Absolute distance (in pixels) since movement started from initial point

offset.desc: Distance (in pixels) since movement started from initial point

delta.desc: Delta of distance (in pixels) since handler was called last time

mightPrevent.desc: Required when you might call event.stopPropagation() in your handler

mouseStop.desc: If listening for mouse events too: stop mouse event propagation

mousePrevent.desc: If listening for mouse events too: calls event.preventDefault() on the mouse events

mouseMightPrevent.desc: If listening for mouse events too: required when you might call event.stopPropagation() in your handler

horizontal.desc: Catch horizontal movement; If 'horizontal' or 'vertical' are not specified, then both directions are considered by default

vertical.desc: Catch vertical movement; If 'horizontal' or 'vertical' are not specified, then both directions are considered by default

TouchPan.description:
Quasar offers full-featured Vue directives that can totally replace libraries like Hammerjs: `v-touch-pan`, `v-touch-swipe`, `v-touch-hold` and even `v-touch-repeat`.
> **These directives also work with mouse events, not only touch events**, so you are able to build cool functionality for your App on desktops too.
We will be describing `v-touch-pan` on the lines below.

arg.desc: String of numbers (at least one number) separated by ':' which defines the amount of time to wait for 1st handler call, 2nd, 3rd and so on; All subsequent calls will use last value as time to wait until triggering

TouchRepeat.description:
Quasar offers full-featured Vue directives that can totally replace libraries like Hammerjs: `v-touch-pan`, `v-touch-swipe`, `v-touch-hold` and `v-touch-repeat`.
> **These directives also work with mouse events, not only touch events**, so you are able to build cool functionality for your App on desktops too.
We will be describing `v-touch-repeat` on the lines below.

duration.desc: How long it took to trigger the event (in milliseconds)

distance.desc: Absolute distance (in pixels) since movement started from initial point

arg.desc: x:y:z, where x is minimum velocity (dist/time), y is minimum distance on first move on mobile, z is minimum distance on desktop until deciding if it's a swipe indeed

Quasar offers full-featured Vue directives that can totally replace libraries like Hammerjs: `v-touch-pan`, `v-touch-swipe`, `v-touch-hold` and even `v-touch-repeat`.
> **These directives also work with mouse events, not only touch events**, so you are able to build cool functionality for your App on desktops too.
